reviews.review_msg: Your classes were great Prep for med school.  Thanks for making me work so hard.
Don't be lazy and take online course thinking you will save time and study more by yourself. It will not happen! You will regret it. This course is HARD, AVOID at all cost.

I'm a hard working student with a GPA of 3.7+ and got slaughtered in this distance class.  I studied hard and was very interested in anatomy before I took the class.  She wants far too much detail for exams and assignments.

Worst proffessor I have ever had. She is unhelpful, blames problems on you "if one person is doing well in the course then everyone can" is her thoughts. Our class average arround 50%. Expected 4-8 pages for assignments worth 1%.Pretty much memorize textbook.Unclear. Does not solve your problem. had to get Dean of Kin involved involded b/c of above

If you can find this course with a different prof, then take it.  Any difficulty you have will not be dealt with as it will be your fault, not hers.  She will look to see if anyone is doing well in the class, and so long as one person is, it will justify her course plan no matter how confusing it is to other students; it's your problem, not hers.

If you can avoid this course as a minor definitley do so. The assignments are ridiculously detailed and the exams are tough also. For the amount of time one puts in there are other courses which will be much more benificial.

for the assignments...you need to pretty much write an essay for each question in order to get it right. there's always something missing. the TA was so anal and wanted an explanation for everything. questions are vague and they don't tell you how much they're worth. definately lots of memorization involved, which means a lot of time.

NEVER take anatomy by distance (I realize that was the first mistake) but if we had had some sort of guidance as to what she was expecting of us there may have been a grade higher than an A- in a group of 30! She expects WAY too much.  This class shouldn't even be offered.  T
